etymology.description: Semantic: 彳(彳) (chì, "step") + Phonetic: 走(走) (zǒu, "walk") = related to walking or journeying -> follower or disciple
etymology.interpretation: The character 徒(徒) (tú, "follower") combines the idea of stepping with walking, suggesting the image of someone who follows or accompanies another over distances.

examples.chinese: 他是孔子的徒(他是孔子的徒)。
examples.english: He is a disciple of Confucius.

examples.chinese: 李明自幼仰慕大师(李明自幼仰慕大師)，成为其忠实的徒(成为其忠实的徒)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐ Míng zì yòu yǎngmù dàshī, chéngwéi qí zhōngshí de tú.
examples.english: Li Ming admired the master since childhood and became his loyal disciple.
